tn.text: God speaks of choosing specific people as calling them by name. AT: "I have chosen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Yahweh continues speaking to Moses.

tn.ref: I have filled Bezalel with my Spirit
tn.text: Yahweh speaks of giving Bezalel his Spirit as if Bezalel were a container and God's Spirit were a liquid. AT: "I have given my Spirit to Bezalel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

The abstract noun "craftsmanship" can be translated as "making crafts" or "making things." AT: "for making all kinds of crafts" or "so that he can make all kinds of things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
Yahweh continues speaking to Moses.
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: I have put skill into the hearts of all who are wise
tn.text: God speaks of making people able to make things as if he were putting the ability into their hearts. AT: "I have given skill to all who are wise" or "I have made all who are wise able to make things well"
This is another name for the tabernacle. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:27:20|27:21]].

The ark is the chest that contains the commandments. This can be stated clearly in the translation. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:26:31|26:33]]. AT: "the chest containing the commandments" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is the lid that sits on top of the ark where the atonement offering was made. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:15|25:17]].
"altar to burn incense." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:30:03|30:03]].
"altar on which offering were burnt." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:30:26|30:28]].
Yahweh continues speaking to Moses.

woven garments** - These were clothing made from narrow linen threads that someone twisted together to make a stronger thread. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:28:06|28:8]].
"These people who are skilled in making beautiful things"

tn.ref: You must certainly keep Yahweh's Sabbath days
tn.text: God speaks of obeying his instructions about the Sabbath as keeping the Sabbath. AT: "You must certainly obey Yahweh's instructions about the Sabbath" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"through all the generations of your descendants." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:12:12|12:14]].

tn.ref: who sets  you apart for himself
tn.text: God speaks of choosing people to be his as setting them apart for himself. AT: "who has chosen you to be his people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: for it must be treated by you as holy
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "for you must treat it as holy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

God speaks of treating the Sabbath with disrespect as defiling it. AT: "Everyone who treats the Sabbath with disrespect" or "Everyone who does not obey the laws about the Sabbath"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: must surely be put to death
tn.text: "must surely be killed."  This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must surely kill" or "you must surely execute" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: must surely be cut off from his people
tn.text: The metaphor "cut off" has at least three possible meanings. They can be expressed in active form: 1) "Yahweh will no longer consider him to be one of his people" 2)  "you must surely send him away" or 3) "you must surely kill him." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"but day 7" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what he must tell the people of Israel.
God speaks of obeying his instructions about the Sabbath as keeping the Sabbath. AT: "must obey Yahweh's instructions about the Sabbath" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: They must observe it throughout their people's generations
tn.text: "They and all the generations of their descendants must observe it." See how you translated "throughout their people's generations" in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:12:12|12:42]].
"a law the will not end." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:28:42|28:43]].

tn.ref: written on by his own hand
tn.text: This can be translated with an active verb. AT: "which Yahweh wrote on with his own hand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
